channel.title: [PI] Teleporting NPC
channel.description:
How do I create an NPC that teleports you? Like when you click it and if your not a donator is comes up with a message saying "Only Donators may use this NPC" but if you are a donator it teleports you to an X + Y coord?
I'll rep++
EDIT: Please no random guess'es. Thanks.

item.title: [PI] Teleporting NPC
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Brackets are only needed if there are multiple lines.

Of course, you could have brackets for single lines, but they aren’t required.

So,

case XXX:
    if (c.donator == 1)
        c.getPA().startTeleport(XXXX, YYYY, H, "modern");
    else
        c.sendMessage("You must be a donator to use this.");    
    break;

Is the same as

case XXX:
    if (c.donator == 1) {
        c.getPA().startTeleport(XXXX, YYYY, H, "modern");
    } else {
        c.sendMessage("You must be a donator to use this.");
    }
    break;

Just less space.[/quote]

Thanks a bunch mate.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Teleporting NPC
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=467951.msg3421309#msg3421309 date=1291527955]
^^^

case XXX: if (c.donator == 1) { c.getPA().startTeleport(XXXX, YYYY, H, "modern"); } else { c.sendMessage("You must be a donator to use this."); } break;

[/quote]Where are your conventions?!

case XXX: if (c.donator == 1) c.getPA().startTeleport(XXXX, YYYY, H, "modern"); else c.sendMessage("You must be a donator to use this."); break;[/quote]

Don’t you need brackets where the “else” is?

Read full topic
